name: incomputable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
unable to be calculated, especially because of being extremely large: He believes that the costs of dealing with dysfunctional children are incomputable. The amount of data stored on a global scale is almost incomputable.
More examplesFewer examplesAn incomputable amount of learning capacity has been lost during the rapid transition to online classes.The game presents an entirely different challenge because of the incomputable number of move options.The economic consequences sustained due to infections with this virus are incomputable.
